title: Arrays
postscript: If your array is empty, even reading array[0] will cause your app to crash. Be careful!
question: Which of these lines create arrays?
hint: Arrays start and end with brackets, e.g. [1, 2, 3, 4, 5].

correct.reason: This creates an array of three strings.
This creates an array of three integers.
This creates an array of three doubles.
This creates an array of one double.
This creates an array of four Booleans.
This creates an array of three strings.

wrong.reason: Arrays start and end with square brackets, [ and ], rather than braces.

wrong.answer: let status = false, true, true, true
wrong.reason: Arrays start and end with square brackets.
This attempts to place a string array into an integer array, which is invalid in Swift.
Arrays start and end with square brackets, [ and ], rather than parentheses.
